member.summary: Searches the current folder for messages that match the specified searching criteria and fetches message envelopes, bodies, headers, flags, attributes, and other message-related information from the server.

Specifies which message elements or attributes to fetch.
Searching criteria which may consist of one or more parameters. When more than one are specified, the results is the intersection (AND) of all the messages that match.
member.returns: A collection of objects that match the specified criteria.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.Deselect(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deselects the currently selected folder and permanently removes all messages marked as deleted (by using ) from the current folder. After calling this method, will be null.
member.param: Indicates whether to permanently removes all messages marked as deleted.

remarks.p: This method uses IMAP CLOSE command to purge the messages. No purging is performed if the current folder is selected as read-only.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.Deselect
member.summary: Deselects the currently selected folder and permanently removes all messages marked as deleted (by using ) from the current folder. After calling this method, will be null.

remarks.p: This method uses IMAP CLOSE command to purge the messages. No purging is performed if the current folder is selected as read-only.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.Select(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Selects the specified folder so that its messages can be accessed.
member.param: The full name of the folder to be selected.
Specifies whether the folder is to be selected as read-only.

remarks.p: You should specify the full name of the folder (including all parent folders' names if the folder is subfolder of another existing folder).
After calling this method, the property will contain an instance of representing the selected folder.
Only one folder can be selected at a time for a single connection, and only the messages in currently selected folder can be accessed. Also, most notifications only occur when a folder is selected.
This method represents IMAP SELECT and EXAMINE commands.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.Select(System.String)
member.summary: Selects the specified folder so that its messages can be accessed.
member.param: The full name of the folder to be selected.

remarks.p: You should specify the full name of the folder (including all parent folders' names if the folder is subfolder of another existing folder).
After calling this method, the property will contain an instance of representing the selected folder.
Only one folder can be selected at a time for a single connection, and only the messages in currently selected folder can be accessed. Also, most notifications only occur when a folder is selected.
This method represents IMAP SELECT and EXAMINE commands.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.CreateFolder(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new folder in the IMAP4 account.
member.param: The full name of the folder to be created.

remarks.p: This method represents IMAP CREATE command.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.DeleteFolder(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a folder with the specified name.
member.param: Folder to be deleted.

remarks.p: This method represents IMAP DELETE command.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.RenameFolder(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Renames a specified folder to a new name.
member.param: Folder to be renamed.
New folder name.

remarks.p: This method represents IMAP RENAME command.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.Subscribe(System.String)
member.summary: Subscribes to the specified folder of the IMAP4 account, adding it to a list of active folders that appear in the folder listings with subscribedOnly parameter set to true.
member.param: The full name of the folder to be subscribed.

remarks.p: This method adds the specified folder to the server's set of "active" or "subscribed" folders as returned by method when subscribedOnly parameter is set to true. This has absolutely NOTHING to do with notifications.
You should specify the full name of the folder (including all parent folders' names if the folder is subfolder of another existing folder).

member.p: This method represents IMAP SUBSCRIBE command.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.Unsubscribe(System.String)
member.summary: Unsubscribes the previously subscribed folder (using the method) of the IMAP4 account, removing it from the list of active folders that appear in the folder listings with subscribedOnly parameter set to true.
member.param: The full name of the folder to be unsubscribed.

remarks.p: This method removes the specified folder from the server's set of "active" or "subscribed" folders as returned by method when subscribedOnly parameter is set to true. This has absolutely NOTHING to do with notifications.
You should specify the full name of the folder (including all parent folders' names if the folder is subfolder of another existing folder).
This method represents IMAP UNSUBSCRIBE command.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.GetFolderInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Gets folder information without selecting it. Only , , , , and properties of the class are available after calling this method.
member.param: The folder name to get information about.
member.returns: An object.

remarks.p: This method represents IMAP STATUS command.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.SetMailboxCheckpoint
member.summary: Requests a checkpoint of the currently selected mailbox.

remarks.p: A checkpoint refers to any implementation-dependent housekeeping associated with the mailbox.
This method represents IMAP CHECK command.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.ListMessagesAsync(ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapMessageSet,ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapEnvelopeParts,ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapCriterion[],ComponentPro.ExtendedAsyncCompletedEventHandler{ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapMessageCollection},System.Object)
member.summary: Asynchronously searches the current folder for messages that match the specified searching criteria and fetches message envelopes, bodies, headers, flags, attributes, and other message-related information from the server.
member.param: A message set containing ordinal message numbers or UIDs.
Specifies which message elements or attributes to fetch.
Searching criteria which may consist of one or more parameters. When more than one are specified, the results is the intersection (AND) of all the messages that match.
An optional asynchronous callback to be invoked when this operation completes. This parameter can be null.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An object that references the asynchronous operation.

Remote port, a number between 1 and 65535, inclusive. The standard IMAP4 port is 143. For TLS/SSL connections, dedicated port is 993.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.Authenticate(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Authenticates the specified user to the remote IMAP server with the specified credentials.
member.param: The user name.
The password.
member.remarks: UltimateMail will try to use the most secure method supported by the server. The order of preference: CRAM-MD5, DIGEST-MD5, PLAIN, LOGIN, ClearText, EXTERNAL, GSSAPI, NTLM. The NTLM, GSSAPI and EXTERNAL methods are only attempted if no other method is available.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.Authenticate(ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapAuthenticationMethod)
member.summary: Authenticates the user to the remote IMAP server using the specified authentication method that does not require credentials. Only NTLM, GSSAPI and External methods are supported.
member.param: The authentication method.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.Authenticate(System.String,System.String,ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapAuthenticationMethod)
member.summary: Authenticates the specified user to the remote IMAP server with the specified credentials using the specified authentication method.
member.param: The user name.
The password.
The authentication method.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.Authenticate(System.String,ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapAuthenticationMethod)
member.summary: Authenticates the user to the IMAP server using an OAuth token.
member.param: The authentication token.
Authentication method (only OAuth 2.0 is supported at the moment).

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.CheckForUpdates(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends NOOP or IDLE command to the server and checks for IMAP server notifications in the specified amount of time.
member.param: Duration of the idle interval, in miliseconds.
member.returns: If any new notifications were received, it returns true and event is fired; otherwise is false.

remarks.p: The method is useful when you want to check for any possible updates including message deleted, message flags changed, etc. from the server. See for a list of supported notifications.
Typically, a client application will call periodically while idle.
This method represents IMAP NOOP or IDLE command. IDLE is used whenever the server supports this command. NOOP command is always used when the duration is less than 10 milliseconds.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.CheckForUpdates
member.summary: Sends NOOP or IDLE command to the server and checks for IMAP server notifications.
member.returns: If any new notifications were received, it returns true and event is fired; otherwise is false.

remarks.p: The method is useful when you want to check for any possible updates including message deleted, message flags changed, etc. from the server. See for a list of supported notifications.
Typically, a client application will call periodically while idle.
This method represents IMAP NOOP command.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.SendCommand(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Sends user-defined command to the server.
member.param: User-defined command text (without line terminator) (eg. "CAPABILITY").
List of parameters. Allowed types are and a byte array.
member.returns: The ID (tag in IMAP4 terms) of the message, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if server does not support it.

remarks.p: After calling this method. You need to call the method to read the response of the server for the command you have sent.

If the specified parameters are string, they are sent without conversion. Byte array parameters are sent as literals - binary blocks of data. Having good understanding of IMAP protocol is strongly recommended when using this method.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.ReadResponse
member.summary: Returns the corresponding response of the IMAP server to the command that was sent using the method.
member.returns: Response of the IMAP server.

The input stream.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value, in milliseconds, indicating after what period of time an IMAP operation (sending commands, waiting for responses or time between data buffer transfers) should timeout.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set to 60000 (60 seconds). Minimal value is 1000. A value of -1 or 0 indicates that the request does not timeout.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.AbortTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value, in milliseconds, indicating after what period of time a IMAP abort operation should timeout.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set to 3000 (3 seconds). Minimal value is 1000.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.LocalEndPoint
member.summary: Gets the local client .
member.value: The that the component is using for communications.
member.remarks: The property gets an that contains the local IP address and port number to which your Socket is bound. You must cast this to an before retrieving any information. You can then call the method to retrieve the local , and the method to retrieve the local port number.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Imap.RemoteEndPoint
member.summary: Gets the remote server .
member.value: The with which the Socket is communicating.
member.remarks: If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, the RemoteEndPoint property gets the EndPoint that contains the remote IP address and port number to which the Socket is connected. If you are using a connectionless protocol, RemoteEndPoint contains the default remote IP address and port number with which the Socket will communicate. You must cast this to an before retrieving any information. You can then call the method to retrieve the remote , and the method to retrieve the remote port number.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Folder
member.summary: Represents a mailbox of the account on the mail server.
member.remarks: The list of mailboxes can be obtained using method of class. In any case, an account on the mail server is guaranteed to contain at least "INBOX" mailbox (case-insensitive). Also, IMAP4 accounts often contain mailboxes such as "Sent", "Drafts", etc.

member.value: Value indicating whether this folder contains any new messages.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether it is possible to select this folder.
member.value: A value indicating whether it is possible to select this folder.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether any subfolders can exist under this folder. This value is only set for folders returned by a call to methods.
member.value: Value indicating whether any child folders can exist under this folder.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Folder.TotalMessages
member.summary: Gets the number of messages in the folder.
member.value: Number of messages in the folder.
member.remarks: This property is not set for folders returned by a call to methods and will contain a value of 0.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Folder.RecentMessages
member.summary: Gets the number of messages that arrived recently. This property is not set for folders returned by a call to methods and will contain a value of 0.
member.value: Number of messages that arrived recently.
member.remarks: If multiple sessions are accessing the mailbox simultaneously, only one of them will be informed about each recently arrived messages. Also, the only reliable way to identify the recent messages is to look at the message flags or to do a search for them.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Folder.NewUnseenMessages
member.summary: Gets the number of messages that have not been read. This property is not set for folders returned by a call to and methods and will contain a value of 0.
member.value: Sequence number of the first message that has not been read.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Folder.NotSeenMessages
member.summary: Gets the number of messages that have not been read. This property is not set for folders returned by a call to methods and will contain a value of 0.
member.value: Number of messages that have not been read.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Folder.UidNext
member.summary: Gets the unique ID to be assigned to a next message that arrives into this folder. This property is not set for folders returned by a call to methods and will contain a value of 0. Also, some servers don't support this, and null (Nothing in Visual Basic) will be returned for these as well.
member.value: Unique ID of the next message.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Folder.UidValidity
member.summary: Gets the validity ID of the mailbox. This property is not set for folders returned by a call to methods and will contain a value of 0.
member.value: The validity ID of the mailbox.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Folder.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the folder.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Folder.ShortName
member.summary: Gets the short name of the mailbox.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Folder.LevelsDelimiter
member.summary: Gets a string that is used to delimit levels of hieararchy under this folder. It usually contains either '/' or '.'. This value is only set for folders returned by a call to methods. For method and property, this will throw an exception.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Folder.KnownPurpose
member.summary: This property is deprecated, new implementations should use the property instead. Returns folder purpose if known. This property only contains useful information if the IMAP server supports the XLIST command or extended LIST command (RFC 6154) and the folder list was returned using the method. At the moment, this is not suppored in listing mailboxes with subscribed mode.

member.summary: Returns true if the property contains the flag. This flag is set if the message has arrived during the current session and it is the first active session to see the message.
member.remarks: Subsequent sessions won't see the flag (unless the folder was selected as read-only during the first session). This flag cannot be altered by the client.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapMessage.IsSeen
member.summary: Returns true if the property contains the Seen flag. This flag is set if the message has been read.

member.summary: UIDPLUS extension support. If this extension is supported, methods will return unique ID of the message on the server.

member.summary: LITERAL+ extension support.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapFeatures.Idle
member.summary: IDLE/DONE command support.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapFeatures.Xlist
member.summary: XLIST command support. This is an extension created by Google for GMail's IMAP. It is used to retrieve information about folder purpose using the method.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapFeatures.Compression
member.summary: Deflate compression (COMPRESS=DEFLATE) extension support.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapFeatures.All
member.summary: All extensions.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapFolderPurpose
member.summary: Specifies special use flags for extended LIST command (RFC 6154) or XLIST extension.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapFolderPurpose.None
member.summary: No special use.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapFolderPurpose.Inbox
member.summary: The folder is an inbox.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapFolderPurpose.All
member.summary: The folder presents all messages in the user's message store (with a possible exception of trash and junk mail). It is usually a virtual folder.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapFolderPurpose.Archive
member.summary: The folder is used to archive messages.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapFolderPurpose.Drafts
member.summary: Thes folder is used to hold draft messages - messages that are being composed but have not yet been sent.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapFolderPurpose.Flagged
member.summary: The folder presents all messages marked in some way as 'important'. It is usually a virtual folder.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapFolderPurpose.Junk
member.summary: The folder is where messages deemed to be junk (spam) mail are held.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapFolderPurpose.Sent
member.summary: The folder is used to hold copies of messages that have been sent. Some server implementations might put messages here automatically.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapFolderPurpose.Trash
member.summary: The folder is used to hold messages that have been deleted. Alternatively, it might be a virtual folder that presentes messages marked for deletion.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.ImapFolderPurpose.Important
member.summary: The folder presents all messages marked by the server as 'important'. It is usually a virtual folder.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.MailMessage.IsSigned
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the message is signed.
member.value: A value indicating whether the message is signed.

remarks.p: Signers of a signed message are accessible through collection. The signature can be validated using method or removed using method. It is created using method.
Please note that messages that are encrypted might also be signed, but because the signature itself is also encrypted as well, this fact will not be known until the message is decrypted.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.MailMessage.IsEncrypted
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the message is encrypted.
member.value: A value indicating whether the message is encrypted.

remarks.p: Recipients of an encrypted message are accessible through collection. The message can be decrypted using method. To encrypt a message, use method.
Until an encrypted message is decrypted, its content is inaccessible.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.MailMessage.Decryptable
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the message can be decrypted.
member.value: A value indicating whether the message can be decrypted.
member.remarks: An encrypted message can only be decrypted if the corresponding private key are available.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.MailMessage.Date
member.summary: Gets or sets the origination date of this message. If origination date is not available, return the date specified by the first 'Received' header.
member.remarks: The origination date specifies the date and time at which the creator of the message indicated that the message was complete and ready to enter the mail delivery system.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.MailMessage.ReceivedDate
member.summary: Gets the received date of this message.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.MailMessage.From
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of authors of this message.

remarks.p: This property specifies the the list of authors of the message.
If this field contains multiple authors, the '' field must be set to specify the agent responsible for the transmission of the message
If this field contains a single author that is also the sender of the message, the '' field should not be set.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.MailMessage.Sender
member.summary: Gets or sets the sender of this message.

remarks.p: This property specifies the agent responsible for the transmission of the message. Use to specify the list of authors of the message.
This field must be set if the '' field contains multiple authors.
This field should not be set if the ' field contains a single author that is also the sender of the message.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.MailMessage.EnvelopeId
member.summary: Gets or sets the envelope identifier to be transmitted along with the message and included in any DSNs issued.

remarks.p: The purpose of the envelope identifier is to allow the sender of a message to identify the transaction for which the DSN was issued.
Please note that the envelope ID is not a part of a mail message and is not saved with it. Its purpose is to be used while sending the message.
Envelope ID must be an ASCII string up to 100 characters in length. Characters < 33 and character '+', '=' and character 127 are represented as three characters.

Preamble is a block of text preceding the first part of a multipart entity. It is usually used to store a short explanatory notice for non-MIME compliant user agents to display.
Default value is "This is a multipart MIME message."
The preamble is only used for multipart entities.

member.name: P:c_G3H.c_GMJ
member.summary: Gets or sets the epilogue of this multipart entity.

remarks.p: Epilogue is only used for multipart entities.
Epilogue is a block of text following the last part of a multipart entity. It might be used to store a message that non-MIME compliant user agents will display.
Default value is an empty string.

member.name: T:c_PLH
member.summary: A MIME e-mail message.
member.remarks: Adds useful properties to class.

member.name: M:c_PLH.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes an instance of .

member.name: M:c_PLH.c_XAB
member.summary: Creates a copy of this message.
member.returns: A new message.

member.name: P:c_PLH.c_FMJ
member.summary: Gets or sets the envelope identifier to be transmitted along with the message and included in any DSNs issued.

remarks.p: The purpose of the envelope identifier is to allow the sender of a message to identify the transaction for which the DSN was issued.
Please note that the envelope ID is not a part of a mail message and is not saved with it. Its purpose is to be used while sending the message.
Envelope ID must be an ASCII string up to 100 characters in length. Characters <33 and character '+', '=' and character 127 are represented as three characters.

member.name: P:c_PLH.c_HNJ
member.summary: Gets or sets the priority of the message.

member.name: P:c_PLH.c_SQH
member.summary: Gets or sets the origination date of this message.
member.remarks: The origination date specifies the date and time at which the creator of the message indicated that the message was complete and ready to enter the mail delivery system.

member.name: P:c_PLH.c_L9
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of authors of this message.

remarks.p: This property specifies the the list of authors of the message.
If this field contains multiple authors, the '' field must be set to specify the agent responsible for the transmission of the message
If this field contains a single author that is also the sender of the message, the '' field should not be set.

member.name: P:c_PLH.c_DA
member.summary: Gets or sets the sender of this message.

remarks.p: This property specifies the agent responsible for the transmission of the message. Use to specify the list of authors of the message.
This field must be set if the '' field contains multiple authors.
This field should not be set if the ' field contains a single author that is also the sender of the message.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.TransferEncoding
member.summary: Type of transfer encoding of the content.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.TransferEncoding.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown content encoding.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.TransferEncoding.QuotedPrintable
member.summary: Quoted-Printable encoding.
member.remarks: The Quoted-Printable encoding is intended to represent data that largely consists of octets that correspond to printable characters in the US-ASCII character set.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.TransferEncoding.Base64
member.summary: Base64 encoding.
member.remarks: The Base64 encoding is designed to represent arbitrary sequences of octets in a form that is not humanly readable.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.TransferEncoding.SevenBit
member.summary: No encoding, content data is 7bit.

remarks.p: 7bit data refers to data that is all represented as relatively short lines with 998 octets or less between CRLF line separation sequences. No octets with decimal values greater than 127 are allowed and neither are NULs (octets with decimal value 0). CR (decimal value 13) and LF (decimal value 10) octets only occur as part of CRLF line separation sequences.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.TransferEncoding.EightBit
member.summary: No encoding, content data is 8bit.
member.remarks: 8bit data refers to data that is all represented as relatively short lines with 998 octets or less between CRLF line separation sequences. Octets with decimal values greater than 127 may be used. CR (decimal value 13) and LF (decimal value 10) octets only occur as part of CRLF line separation sequences.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.TransferEncoding.Binary
member.summary: No encoding, content data is binary.
member.remarks: Binary data refers to data where any sequence of octets is allowed.

member.name: T:c_Q7J
member.summary: LineReceiver is an abstract write-only stream that breaks all incoming data into lines of a given maximum length delimited by CRLF sequences. When a complete line is processed, the virtual method is called and the line is passed as a parameter. Classes that need this functionality should inherit from and override the method.

member.returns: The encoded text. Implementations of this method must not return null (if they don't know what to return, they can throw).
member.remarks: Protocol for the encoding of MIME header values into the "Q" encoding is defined by RFC 2047.

member.name: F:c_KEJ.c_PDK
member.summary: 2.584: Contains a displayable form of the Address Book object that can be rendered in the client user's own code page. Data Type: String.

member.name: F:c_KEJ.c_QDK
member.summary: 2.585: Indicates the operations available to the client for the object. Contains a bitmask of flags indicating the operations that are available to the client for the object. Data Type: Integer32.
member.remarks:
This property is read-only for the client. It must be a bitwise OR of zero or more values from the following table.
NameValueDescription
MAPI_ACCESS_MODIFY0x0001Write
MAPI_ACCESS_READ0x0002Read
MAPI_ACCESS_DELETE0x0004Delete
MAPI_ACCESS_CREATE_HIERARCHY0x0008Create subfolders in the folder hierarchy
MAPI_ACCESS_CREATE_CONTENTS0x0010Create content messages
MAPI_ACCESS_CREATE_ASSOCIATED0x0020Create associated content messages
The MAPI_ACCESS_DELETE, MAPI_ACCESS_MODIFY, and MAPI_ACCESS_READ flags are found on folder and message objects and in the PR_ACCESS column in contents tables and associated contents tables. The MAPI_ACCESS_CREATE_ASSOCIATED, MAPI_ACCESS_CREATE_CONTENTS, and MAPI_ACCESS_CREATE_HIERARCHY flags are found on folder objects only.

member.name: F:c_KEJ.c_RDK
member.summary: 2.586: Indicates the client's access level to the object. Data Type: Integer32.
member.remarks:
This property is read-only for the client. It must be one of the following values:
ValueDescription
0x0000Read-Only
0x0001Modify

member.name: F:c_KEJ.c_HGK
member.summary: 2.657: Contains encoding information about the Attachment object. Data Type: Binary.
member.remarks: Contains an ASN.1 object identifier that specifies the encoding for an attachment. PidTagAttachEncoding property identifies the algorithm used to transform the data in an attachment. NOTE: The PR_ATTACH_ENCODING and PR_ATTACH_TAG (PidTagAttachTag) properties should not be confused. They are not paired or related. PR_ATTACH_TAG identifies the application that originally generated the attachment. "Object" has a much more general meaning in the term object identifier, and in X.400, than in object-oriented programming. The object identifier syntax and sample object identifiers are defined in the MAPIOID.H header file. Values for PR_ATTACH_ENCODING are not limited to those defined in MAPIOID.H. For example, attached Macintosh files can use an identifier such as MacBinary. For complete information on these object identifiers, see the documentation on ASN.1, X.208, and X.209. The object identifier is found in the application-reference element of the FTBP (File Transfer Body Part) environment.

member.summary: 2.668: Contains formatting information about a Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) attachment. These properties are copied from the Content-type parameter of the inbound MIME header. The composition of the string is defined in the RFC 1521 document. member.name: F:c_KEJ.c_HNK
member.summary: 2.822: PidTagImapCachedMsgsize. Data Type: Binary.

member.name: F:c_KEJ.c_JNK
member.summary: 2.823: Indicates the level of importance assigned by the end user to the Message object. Data Type: Integer32.
member.remarks: This property and the PR_PRIORITY (PidTagPriority) property should not be confused. Importance indicates a value to users, while priority indicates the order or speed at which the message should be sent by the messaging system software. Higher priority usually indicates a higher cost. Higher importance usually is associated with a different display by the user interface. This property can have exactly one of the following values: IMPORTANCE_LOW The message has low importance. IMPORTANCE_HIGH The message has high importance. IMPORTANCE_NORMAL The message has normal importance.

member.name: F:c_KEJ.c_XPK
member.summary: 2.891: Specifies the status of the Message object. Contains a bitmask of flags that indicate the origin and current state of a message. Data Type: Integer32.
member.remarks:
This property is a nontransmittable message property exposed at both the sending and receiving ends of a transmission, with different values depending upon the client application or store provider involved. This property is initialized by the client or message store provider when a message is created and saved for the first time and then updated periodically by the message store provider, a transport provider, and the MAPI spooler as the message is processed and its state changes. This property exists on a message both before and after submission, and on all copies of the received message. Although it is not a recipient property, it is exposed differently to each recipient according to whether it has been read or modified by that recipient. One or more of the following flags can be set for this property:
NameValueDescription
mfRead0x0001The message is marked as having been read.
mfUnsent 0x0008The message is still being composed. This bit is cleared by the server when responding to RopSubmitMessage with a success code. See [MS-OXOMSG] for details.
mfResend0x0080The message includes a request for a resend operation with a non-delivery report. See [MS-OXOMSG] for details.
These flags are always read-only for the client:
TypeValueDescription
mfUnmodified0x0002The message has not been modified since it was first saved (if unsent) or it was delivered (if sent).
mfSubmitted0x0004The message is marked for sending as a result of a call to RopSubmitMessage [MS-OXOMSG].
mfHasAttach0x0010The message has at least one attachment. This flag corresponds to the message's PidTagHasAttachmentsproperty.
mfFromMe 0x0020The user receiving the message was also the user who sent the message.
mfFAI0x0040The message is an FAI message.
mfNotifyRead0x0100The user who sent the message has requested notification when a recipient first reads it.
mfNotifyUnread0x0200The user who sent the message has requested notification when a recipient deletes it before reading or the Message object expires as specified in [MS-OXOMSG].
mfEverRead0x0400The message has been read at least once. This flag is set or cleared by the server whenever the mfRead flag is set or cleared.
mfInternet0x2000The incoming message arrived over the Internet and originated either outside the organization or from a source the gateway does not consider trusted.
mfUntrusted0x8000The incoming message arrived over an external link other than X.400 or the Internet. It originated either outside the organization or from a source the gateway does not consider trusted.
MSGFLAG_ASSOCIATED The message is an associated message of a folder. The client or provider has read-only access to this flag. The MSGFLAG_READ flag is ignored for associated messages, which do not retain a read/unread state. MSGFLAG_FROMME The messaging user sending was the messaging user receiving the message. The client or provider has read/write access to this flag until the first IMAPIProp::SaveChanges call and read-only thereafter. This flag is meant to be set by the transport provider. MSGFLAG_HASATTACH The message has at least one attachment. This flag corresponds to the message's PR_HASATTACH (PidTagHasAttachments) property. The client has read-only access to this flag. MSGFLAG_NRN_PENDING A nonread report needs to be sent for the message. The client or provider has read-only access to this flag. MSGFLAG_ORIGIN_INTERNET The incoming message arrived over the Internet. It originated either outside the organization or from a source the gateway cannot consider trusted. The client should display an appropriate message to the user. Transport providers set this flag; the client has read-only access. MSGFLAG_ORIGIN_MISC_EXT The incoming message arrived over an external link other than X.400 or the Internet. It originated either outside the organization or from a source the gateway cannot consider trusted. The client should display an appropriate message to the user. Transport providers set this flag; the client has read-only access. MSGFLAG_ORIGIN_X400 The incoming message arrived over an X.400 link. It originated either outside the organization or from a source the gateway cannot consider trusted. The client should display an appropriate message to the user. Transport providers set this flag; the client has read-only access. MSGFLAG_READ The message is marked as having been read. This can occur as the result of a call at any time to IMessage::SetReadFlag or IMAPIFolder::SetReadFlags. Clients can also set this flag by calling a message's IMAPIProp::SetProps method before the message has been saved for the first time. This flag is ignored if the MSGFLAG_ASSOCIATED flag is set. MSGFLAG_RESEND The message includes a request for a resend operation with a nondelivery report. The client or provider has read/write access to this flag until the first IMAPIProp::SaveChanges call and read-only thereafter. MSGFLAG_RN_PENDING A read report needs to be sent for the message. The client or provider has read-only access to this flag. MSGFLAG_SUBMIT The message is marked for sending as a result of a call to IMessage::SubmitMessage. Message store providers set this flag; the client has read-only access. MSGFLAG_UNMODIFIED The outgoing message has not been modified since the first time that it was saved; the incoming message has not been modified since it was delivered. MSGFLAG_UNSENT The message is still being composed. It is saved, but has not been sent. The client or provider has read/write access to this flag until the first IMAPIProp::SaveChanges call and read-only thereafter. If a client doesn't set this flag by the time the message is sent, the message store provider sets it when IMessage::SubmitMessage is called. Typically, this flag is cleared after the message is sent. A client or message store provider can check the current state of the message at any time by calling the IMAPIProp::GetProps method to read the flag values. The client or provider can also call the IMAPIProp::SetProps method to change any flags that currently have read/write access. Several of the flags are always read-only. Some are read/write until the first call to the IMAPIProp::SaveChanges method and thereafter become read-only as far as IMAPIProp::SetProps is concerned. One of these, MSGFLAG_READ, can be changed later through IMessage::SetReadFlag or IMAPIFolder::SetReadFlags. The initial values for this property are typically MSGFLAG_UNSENT and MSGFLAG_UNMODIFIED to indicate a message that has not yet been sent or changed. When a message is saved for the second time, the message store provider clears the MSGFLAG_UNMODIFIED flag. Another value that a message store provider can set when a message is saved is the MSGFLAG_HASATTACH flag, indicating that the message has one or more attachments. The PR_HASATTACH property is computed from this setting. When a client calls the IMessage::SubmitMessage method to send the message, the message store provider makes a copy of it for the MAPI spooler and updates this property by setting the MSGFLAG_SUBMIT flag. The message store provider also sets MSGFLAG_UNSENT if it is not yet set. MSGFLAG_SUBMIT indicates that SubmitMessage has been called, beginning the send process, and that the message is now read-only to the client. MSGFLAG_UNSENT indicates that the MAPI spooler is handling the message. If the send process is canceled, the message store provider resets this flag. When the message is given to a transport provider for delivery, the transport provider sets the MSGFLAG_FROMME flag if the sender had the same account on the messaging server as the message was received on. Transport providers set MSGFLAG_FROMME for an incoming message that was sent by the currently logged on user. A client can use this value to determine that it is more appropriate to show recipient names in the contents table of the Sent Items folder than sender names. Messages that have been saved during the composition process and not yet sent should also be displayed with recipient names rather than sender names. For an incoming message, a message store provider clears the MSGFLAG_READ flag to reset its read status. A client can set or clear the MSGFLAG_READ flag when it is necessary to change the read status and control the sending of read and nonread reports, by calling either the message's IMessage::SetReadFlag method or its folder's IMAPIFolder::SetReadFlags method. The main difference between these methods, other than the object implementing them, is that the folder method can affect one, several, or all of the messages in the folder. The message method affects a single message. A client should also test an incoming message for the MSGFLAG_ORIGIN_X400, MSGFLAG_ORIGIN_INTERNET, and MSGFLAG_ORIGIN_MISC_EXT flags. These flags are set by the inbound transport provider and indicate that the message arrived from a source that the gateway cannot consider trusted. This means the message originated either outside the organization, or internally but from a workstation not known to the gateway. In any case, the identity of the sender may not be confirmed, and there is a risk of introducing a computer virus into the organization. The client should display a warning message to the user and offer an option of deleting the message without opening it. Message store providers set the MSGFLAG_UNMODIFIED flag for incoming messages. MSGFLAG_UNMODIFIED indicates that a message has not been changed since delivery. A client cannot clear this value after it has been set by a message store provider.

member.name: F:c_KEJ.c_RRK
member.summary: 2.949: Indicates whether an e-mail sender requests an e-mail delivery receipt from the messaging system. Contains TRUE if a message sender requests a delivery report for a particular recipient from the messaging system before the message is placed in the message store. Data Type: Boolean.
member.remarks: This property is used to direct the messaging system in handling delivered messages. In this case, the message must also furnish the PR_ORIGINATOR_NON_DELIVERY_REPORT_REQUESTED (PidTagOriginatorNonDeliveryReportRequested) property set to FALSE. Setting the PR_ORIGINATOR_DELIVERY_REPORT_REQUESTED property on a message is a way to request delivery status reports for all recipients.

member.name: F:c_KEJ.c_SSK
member.summary: 2.975: Indicates the client's request for the priority at which the message is to be sent by the messaging system. Data Type: Integer32.
member.remarks: This property and the PR_IMPORTANCE (PidTagImportance) property should not be confused. Importance indicates a value to users, while priority indicates the order or speed at which the message should be sent by the messaging system software. Higher priority usually indicates a higher cost. Higher importance usually is associated with a different display by the user interface. The priority of a report message should be the same as the priority of the original message being reported. This property can have exactly one of the following values: PRIO_NONURGENT The message is not urgent. PRIO_NORMAL The message has normal priority. PRIO_URGENT The message is urgent.

member.remarks: This property must be set to TRUE to validate the values in the PR_READ_RECEIPT_ENTRYID (PidTagReadReceiptEntryId) and PR_READ_RECEIPT_SEARCH_KEY (PidTagReadReceiptSearchKey) properties. If a message with PR_READ_RECEIPT_REQUESTED set is deleted or expires before the messaging system can generate a read report, a nonread report is generated.

member.name: F:c_KEJ.c_ZTK
member.summary: 2.1007: Specifies a bit field that describes the recipient status. Data Type: Integer32.
member.remarks:
This property is not required. The following are the individual flags that can be set.
S (recipSendable, 0x00000001) The recipient is a Sendable Attendee. This flag is only used in the dispidApptUnsendableRecips (PidLidAppointmentUnsendableRecipients) property.
O (recipOrganizer, 0x0000002) The RecipientRow on which this flag is set represents the meeting Organizer.
ER (recipExceptionalResponse, 0x00000010) Indicates that the attendee gave a response for the exception on which this RecipientRow resides. This flag is only used in a RecipientRow of an exception embedded message object of the organizer's meeting object.
ED (recipExceptionalDeleted, 0x00000020) Indicates that although the RecipientRow exists, it should be treated as if the corresponding recipient does not. This flag is only used in a RecipientRow of an exception embedded message object of the organizer's meeting object.
X (reserved, 0x00000040) Must not be set.
X (reserved, 0x00000080) Must not be set.
G (recipOriginal, 0x00000100) Indicates the recipient is an original attendee. This flag is only used in the dispidApptUnsendableRecips property.
X (reserved, 0x00000200) Reserved.

member.name: F:c_KEJ.c_VXK
member.summary: 2.1108: Contains a unique binary-comparable key that identifies an object for a search. Data Type: Binary.
member.remarks: This property provides a trace for related objects, such as message copies, and facilitates finding unwanted occurrences, such as duplicate recipients. MAPI uses specific rules for constructing search keys for message recipients. The search key is formed by concatenating the address type (in uppercase characters), the colon character ':', the e-mail address in canonical form, and the terminating null character. Canonical form here means that case-sensitive addresses appear in the correct case, and addresses that are not case-sensitive are converted to uppercase. This is important in preserving correlations among messages. For message objects, this property is available through the IMAPIProp::GetProps method immediately following message creation. For other objects, it is available following the first call to the IMAPIProp::SaveChanges method. Because this property is changeable, it is unreliable to obtain it through GetProps until a SaveChanges call has committed any values set or changed by the IMAPIProp::SetProps method. For profiles, MAPI also furnishes a hard-coded profile section named MUID_PROFILE_INSTANCE, with this property as its single property. This key is guaranteed to be unique among all profiles ever created, and can be more reliable than the PR_PROFILE_NAME (PidTagProfileName) property, which can be, for example, deleted and recreated with the same name.

member.name: F:c_KEJ.c_GYK
member.summary: 2.1123: Contains a bitmask of message encoding preferences for e-mail sent to an e-mail-enabled entity that is represented by this Address Book object. Data Type: Integer32.
member.remarks: When sending mail by using the RFC2822 and MIME to the E-mail Object Conversion protocol, as specified in [MS-OXCMAIL], the PidTagSendInternetEncoding property specifies the format of the MIME body, as specified in [MS-OXCMAIL]. PidTagSendInternetEncoding property contains the following flags: BODY_ENCODING_HTML: Encode the message text in HTML. This flag is ignored unless the ENCODING_MIME flag is set. BODY_ENCODING_TEXT_AND_HTML: Encode the message text using text and HTML as Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) multipart alternatives. This flag is ignored unless the ENCODING_MIME flag is set. ENCODING_MIME: Encode the message using MIME. If this flag is not set, MAPI encodes the message text in plain text and the attachments in UUENCODE. ENCODING_PREFERENCE: Use the other flags in this bitmask to determine the encoding. If this flag is not set, MAPI leaves it to the messaging system to make encoding decisions. MAC_ATTACH_ENCODING_APPLEDOUBLE: Encode Macintosh attachments in Apple double mode. This flag is ignored unless the ENCODING_MIME flag is set. MAC_ATTACH_ENCODING_APPLESINGLE: Encode Macintosh attachments in Apple single mode. This flag is ignored unless the ENCODING_MIME flag is set. MAC_ATTACH_ENCODING_UUENCODE: Encode Macintosh attachments in UUENCODE. If the ENCODING_MIME flag is set, this flag is ignored and BinHex encoding is used instead.

member.name: F:c_KEJ.c_HYK
member.summary: 2.1124: Contains TRUE if the e-mail-enabled entity represented by the Address Book object can receive all message content, including Rich Text Format (RTF) and other embedded objects. Data Type: Boolean.

member.name: F:c_KEJ.c_JYK
member.summary: 2.1125: Indicates the sender's assessment of the sensitivity of the Message object. Contains a value that indicates the message sender's opinion of the sensitivity of a message. Data Type: Integer32.
member.remarks: It is recommended that message objects expose this property. This property can have exactly one of the following values: SENSITIVITY_NONE The message has no special sensitivity. SENSITIVITY_PERSONAL The message is personal. SENSITIVITY_PRIVATE The message is private. SENSITIVITY_COMPANY_CONFIDENTIAL The message is designated company confidential.

member.name: F:c_KEJ.c_KYK

member.name: F:c_KEJ.c_DFJ
member.summary: 2.1127: Contains an e-mail address type. Data Type: String.

member.name: F:c_KEJ.c_EFJ
member.summary: 2.1128: Contains the contents of the 'email' element of the 'author' element in an Atom item, if it exists. Contains the e-mail address for the messaging user who is represented by the sender. Data Type: String.
member.remarks: These properties are examples of the address properties for the messaging user being represented by the sender. When a client application sends a message on behalf of another client, it should set all the represented sender properties to the values for that client. A messaging user sending on its own behalf typically leaves the represented sender properties unset. The outgoing transport provider must always leave these properties unchanged if it has been set by the sending client. If it is unset, the transport provider should set it to the PR_SENDER_EMAIL_ADDRESS (PidTagSenderEmailAddress) property on the outbound copy of the message, and leave it unset on the local copy.

member.name: F:c_SHM.c_N0A
member.summary: No flags.

member.name: F:c_SHM.c_R4B
member.summary: The message is marked as having been read.

member.name: F:c_SHM.c_THM
member.summary: The message is still being composed. This bit is cleared by the server when responding to RopSubmitMessage with a success code. See [MS-OXOMSG] for details.

member.name: F:c_SHM.c_UHM
member.summary: The message includes a request for a resend operation with a non-delivery report. See [MS-OXOMSG] for details.

member.name: F:c_SHM.c_VHM
member.summary: The message has not been modified since it was first saved (if unsent) or it was delivered (if sent).

member.name: F:c_SHM.c_WHM
member.summary: The message is marked for sending as a result of a call to RopSubmitMessage [MS-OXOMSG].

member.name: F:c_SHM.c_XHM
member.summary: The message has at least one attachment. This flag corresponds to the message's PidTagHasAttachmentsproperty.

member.name: F:c_SHM.c_YHM
member.summary: The user receiving the message was also the user who sent the message.

member.name: F:c_SHM.c_ZHM
member.summary: The message is an FAI message.

member.name: F:c_SHM.c_AJM
member.summary: The user who sent the message has requested notification when a recipient first reads it.

member.name: F:c_SHM.c_BJM
member.summary: The user who sent the message has requested notification when a recipient deletes it before reading or the Message object expires as specified in [MS-OXOMSG].

member.name: F:c_SHM.c_CJM
member.summary: The message has been read at least once. This flag is set or cleared by the server whenever the mfRead flag is set or cleared.

member.name: F:c_SHM.c_AQB
member.summary: The incoming message arrived over the Internet and originated either outside the organization or from a source the gateway does not consider trusted.

member.name: F:c_SHM.c_DJM
member.summary: The incoming message arrived over an external link other than X.400 or the Internet. It originated either outside the organization or from a source the gateway does not consider trusted.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_FJM
member.summary: The message store supports properties that contain ANSI (8-bit) characters.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_GJM
member.summary: The message store supports attachments (OLE or non-OLE) to messages.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_HJM
member.summary: The message store supports categorized views of tables.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_JJM
member.summary: The message store supports creation of new messages.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_KJM
member.summary: Entry identifiers for the objects in the message store are unique, that is, never reused during the life of the store.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_MJM
member.summary: The message store supports HTML messages, stored in the PR_BODY_HTML (PidTagBodyHtml) property. If your development environment uses a MAPIDEFS.H file that does not include STORE_HTML_OK, use the value 0x00010000 instead.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_LJM
member.summary: In a wrapped PST store, indicates that when a new message arrives at the store, the store performs rules and spam filter processing on the message separately. The store calls IMAPISupport::Notify, setting fnevNewMail in the NOTIFICATION structure that is passed as a parameter, and then passes the details of the new message to the listening client. Subsequently, when the listening client receives the notification, it does not process rules on the message.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_NJM
member.summary: This flag is reserved and should not be used.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_OJM
member.summary: The message store supports modification of its existing messages.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_PJM
member.summary: The message store supports multivalued properties, guarantees the stability of value order in a multivalued property throughout a save operation, and supports instantiation of multivalued properties in tables.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_QJM
member.summary: The message store supports notifications.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_RJM
member.summary: The message store supports OLE attachments. The OLE data can be accessed through an IStorage interface, such as that available through the PR_ATTACH_DATA_OBJ (PidTagAttachDataObject) property.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_SJM
member.summary: The folders in this store are public (multi-user), not private (possibly multi-instance but not multi-user).

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_TJM
member.summary: The MAPI Protocol Handler will not crawl the store, and the store is responsible for pushing any changes through notifications to the indexer to have messages indexed.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_UJM
member.summary: All interfaces for the message store have a read-only access level.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_VJM
member.summary: The message store supports restrictions.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_WJM
member.summary: The message store supports Rich Text Format (RTF) messages, usually compressed, and the store itself keeps PR_BODY and PR_RTF_COMPRESSED synchronized.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_XJM
member.summary: Indicates that rules should be stored in this PST store even if it is not the default store. When STORE_RULES_OK is used in conjunction with NON_EMS_XP_SAVE, rules are able to run on non-default PST wrapped stores.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_YJM
member.summary: The message store supports search-results folders.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_ZJM
member.summary: The message store supports sorting views of tables.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_AKM
member.summary: The message store supports marking a message for submission.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_BKM
member.summary: The message store supports storage of RTF messages in uncompressed form. An uncompressed RTF stream is identified by the value dwMagicUncompressedRTF in the stream header. The dwMagicUncompressedRTF value is defined in the RTFLIB.H file.

member.name: F:c_EJM.c_CKM
member.summary: Indicates that the message store supports Unicode storage. A client can look for the presence of the flag to decide whether to request or to save Unicode information to the store.

member.summary: Gets or sets the plain text BODY (PidTagBody) of this . If PidTagBody is not present, returns the text taken from the , but only if RTF came from plain text (this is if the \fromtext control word is specified within the RTF header). This behavior is reversed if the .PreferBodyTextFromRtf is set to true.
member.value: A plain text BODY of the message.

member.name: P:c_GDJ.c_VNJ
member.summary: Gets the HTML BODY (PidTagBodyHtml) of this . If PidTagBodyHtml is not present, returns the text taken from the , but only if RTF came from HTML (this is if the \fromhtml control word is specified within the RTF header). This behavior is reversed if the .PreferBodyHtmlFromRtf is set to true.
member.value: A HTML BODY of the message.

member.name: T:c_XUM
member.summary: This class is used for storing individual element from the color table from the rtf format. The element defines the RGB representation of the color and the name for this color. In addition, there are two optional parameters - tint and shade.

member.name: M:c_XUM.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: RtfColorTableElement constructor.
member.param: The name for the color defined.
The red component of the color. Between 0 and 255.
The green component of the color. Between 0 and 255.
The blue component of the color. Between 0 and 255.
The tint of the color. Between 0 and 255. 255 = no tint, 0 = white color.
The shade of the color. Between 0 and 255. 255 = no shade, 0 = full shade, i.e. black color.

member.summary: Lets UltimateMail automatically select the best supported authentication method.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Pop3AuthenticationMethod.SaslPlain
member.summary: SASL PLAIN authentication (RFC 2831 DIGEST-MD5). Passwords are transmitted as Base64 strings. Not secure but widely supported.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Pop3AuthenticationMethod.SaslDigestMD5
member.summary: Secure SASL DIGEST-MD5 authentication (RFC 2831 DIGEST-MD5). Might not be supported by particular server implementations.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Pop3AuthenticationMethod.SaslCramMD5
member.summary: Secure SASL CRAM-MD5 authentication (RFC 2195 CRAM-MD5). Might not be supported by particular server implementations.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Pop3AuthenticationMethod.SaslLogin
member.summary: SASL LOGIN authentication. Passwords are transmitted as Base64 strings. Not secure but widely supported.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Pop3AuthenticationMethod.ClearText
member.summary: Clear text USER/PASS login.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Pop3AuthenticationMethod.APop
member.summary: Secure APOP authentication. Supported by many POP3 servers.

member.returns: The welcome message returned by the remote POP3 server.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Pop3.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects from the POP3 server and releases any used resources. All messages marked as deleted will be permanently removed.
member.returns: The exit message returned by the server.
member.remarks: On successful completion of this method, all the messages marked as deleted during the POP3 session are physically deleted by the server. If this method fails, the connection is still closed and all network resources are freed, but it's undefined whether the messages marked for deletion were really deleted or not.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Pop3.Disconnect(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes any messages marked as deleted and terminate the connection.
member.param: true if messages marked as deleted should be left on the server.
member.returns: The exit message returned by the server.
member.remarks: Represents POP3 QUIT command, with optional preceeding RSET.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Pop3.Authenticate(System.String,System.String,ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Pop3AuthenticationMethod)
member.summary: Authenticates the specified user to the remote POP3 server with the specified credentials using the specified authentication method.
member.param: The user name.
The password.
The authentication method.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Pop3.Authenticate(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Authenticates the specified user to the remote POP3 server with the specified credentials using the Auto mode.
member.param: The user name.
The password.
member.remarks: UltimateMail will try to use the most secure method supported by the server but will downgrade to less secure methods (to the simplest "LOGIN account password" authentication in the worst case) if better methods are not available.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Pop3.Undelete

member.summary: Flags the specified message for deletion from the server.

Represents POP3 DELE command.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Smtp.Send(ComponentPro.Net.Mail.MailMessage,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends the mail message to the specified recipients.
member.param: The message to send.
Message sender address.
The list of recipients.

remarks.p: This method blocks while the e-mail is transmitted. You can specify a time-out value using the property to ensure that the method returns after a specified amount of time elapses.

Before calling this method, the method must be called. You cannot call this method if there is a message being sent asynchronously. If the SMTP host requires credentials, must be called prior to calling this method.
If you receive an exception, check the property to find the reason the operation failed. The can also contain an inner exception that indicates the reason the operation failed.

The sender address is taken from the "Sender" header field or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. The list of recipients comes from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. The "Bcc" field is removed from message headers before sending.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Smtp.Send(ComponentPro.Net.Mail.MailMessage)
member.summary: Sends the mail message to the recipients specified in the message.
member.param: The message to send.

remarks.p: This method blocks while the e-mail is transmitted. You can specify a time-out value using the property to ensure that the method returns after a specified amount of time elapses.

Before calling this method, the method must be called. You cannot call this method if there is a message being sent asynchronously. If the SMTP host requires credentials, must be called prior to calling this method.
If you receive an SmtpException exception, check the property to find the reason the operation failed. The can also contain an inner exception that indicates the reason the operation failed.

The sender address is taken from the "Sender" header field or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. The list of recipients comes from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. The "Bcc" field is removed from message headers before sending.

member.summary: Reads and sends a mail message from the specified stream in MIME format.
member.param: The input stream in MIME format. The stream must contain data in MIME format, other formats are not supported.

remarks.p: This method blocks while the e-mail is transmitted. You can specify a time-out value using the property to ensure that the method returns after a specified amount of time elapses.

Before calling this method, the method must be called. You cannot call this method if there is a message being sent asynchronously. If the SMTP host requires credentials, must be called prior to calling this method.
If you receive an exception, check the property to find the reason the operation failed. The can also contain an inner exception that indicates the reason the operation failed.

The sender address is taken from the "Sender" header field or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. The list of recipients comes from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. The "Bcc" field is removed from message headers before sending.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Smtp.Send(System.String)
member.summary: Reads and sends a mail message from the specified local file in MIME format.
member.param: The path to the mail message file. The file must be in MIME format, other formats are not supported.

remarks.p: This method blocks while the e-mail is transmitted. You can specify a time-out value using the property to ensure that the method returns after a specified amount of time elapses.

Before calling this method, the method must be called. You cannot call this method if there is a message being sent asynchronously. If the SMTP host requires credentials, must be called prior to calling this method.
If you receive an SmtpException exception, check the property to find the reason the operation failed. The can also contain an inner exception that indicates the reason the operation failed.

The sender address is taken from the "Sender" header field or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. The list of recipients comes from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. The "Bcc" field is removed from message headers before sending.

member.returns: An object containing the verification result. On success, the resulting will have a of 2.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Smtp.Send(System.String,ComponentPro.Net.Mail.SmtpSendOptions)
member.summary: Reads a mail message from the specified local file in MIME format and sends it using the specified SMTP server.
member.param: The path to the mail message file.
The SmtpSendOptions class.

remarks.p: The file must be in MIME format, other formats are not supported. MIME files often have the '.eml' extension and are produced by Outlook Express. In contrast, Outlook produces '.msg' files that are not MIME files and therefore cannot be sent using this method.

Both sender and the list of recipients are extracted from the message. The sender address is taken from the "Sender" header field, or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. The list of recipients comes from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. Also, the "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Smtp.Send(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,ComponentPro.Net.Mail.SmtpSendOptions)
member.summary: Sends a mail message constructed from the specified parameters using the specified SMTP server.
member.param: Message sender.
Comma-separated list of message recipients.
The subject of the message.
The text body of the message.
The SmtpSendOptions class.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value, in milliseconds, indicating after what period of time an SMTP operation (sending commands, waiting for responses or time between data buffer transfers) should timeout.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Smtp.AbortTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value, in milliseconds, indicating after what period of time an SMTP abort operation should timeout.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Smtp.LocalEndPoint
member.summary: Gets the local client .
member.value: The that the component is using for communications.
member.remarks: The property gets an that contains the local IP address and port number to which your Socket is bound. You must cast this to an before retrieving any information. You can then call the method to retrieve the local , and the method to retrieve the local port number.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Mail.Smtp.RemoteEndPoint
member.summary: Gets the remote server .
member.value: The with which the Socket is communicating.
member.remarks: If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, the property gets the EndPoint that contains the remote IP address and port number to which the Socket is connected. If you are using a connectionless protocol, contains the default remote IP address and port number with which the Socket will communicate. You must cast this to an before retrieving any information. You can then call the method to retrieve the remote , and the method to retrieve the remote port number.
